com.telek.telekmath.helpers

Class TMath

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.telek.telekmath.helpers.TMath

  • public final class TMath
extends java.lang.Object
    A class that has a lot of utility functions. atn(), atan2(), acos(), asin() methods were written by Tommy Ettinger, https://github.com/tommyettinger

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      TMath()

      static double beta(double a, double b)
      Uses Apache Common Math's Beta.logBeta function to evaluate beta(a,b)
      static int combination(int n, int r) 
      static int factorial(int num)
      Fast factorial function that only works with integers
      static int floor(double x)
      This method is A lot faster than using '(int) Math.floor(x)'
      static double gamma(double x)
      Uses Apache Common Math's Gamma.logGamma function to evaluate gamma(x)

      Works in linear time aka O(n)

      Takes oldX from [-1,1] and returns what it would be in [0,1]

      Takes oldX from the range [oldA, oldB] and returns what it would represent if it was in range [newA, newB]

        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if n is prime, else false

        Parameters:

        exponent - any integer
        Returns:
        base ^ exponent

      • mapRange

        public static double mapRange(double oldRangeLeft,
                              double oldRangeRight,
                              double newRangeLeft,
                              double newRangeRight,
                              double oldX)
        Takes oldX from the range [oldA, oldB] and returns what it would represent if it was in range [newA, newB]
        Parameters:
        oldRangeLeft - start value of old interval (left value)
        oldRangeRight - end value of old interval (right value)
        newRangeLeft - start value of new interval (left value)
        newRangeRight - end value of new interval (right value)
        oldX - any value from the old interval aka [oldRangeLeft, oldRangeRight]
        Returns:
        The new value of oldX in the new interval aka [newRangeLeft, newRangeRight]

      • mapRange

        public static double mapRange(double oldX)
        Takes oldX from [-1,1] and returns what it would be in [0,1]
        Parameters:
        oldX - any value from [-1,1] interval
        Returns:
        the value of oldX in [0,1] interval

      • floor

        public static int floor(double x)
        This method is A lot faster than using '(int) Math.floor(x)'
        Parameters:
        x - any double value
        Returns:
        floor(x)
